content:
What is the proper arrangement of elements for referencing a book in MLA format, including the necessary punctuation and indentation? Can you provide an example using the following book information?
Author: Jane Austen
Book Title: Pride and Prejudice
Publisher: Penguin Classics
Publication Date: 2003
Medium of Publication: Print
Please include the HTML code for formatting the citation in MLA style on a webpage.

In MLA format, the proper arrangement for referencing a book is as follows: 1. Author's Last name, First name. 2. Title of Book (italicized). 3. Publisher, 4. Publication Date. 5. Medium of Publication. For the given book information, the citation would be formatted like this: Austen, Jane. *Pride and Prejudice*. Penguin Classics, 2003. Print. To display this citation on a webpage using HTML, you can use the following code: ```html

Austen, Jane. Pride and Prejudice. Penguin Classics, 2003. Print.

``` This HTML code will ensure that the book title is italicized, following the MLA citation style.
